clinical_study.brief_title: Gore Tex Implants in the Treatment of Atrophic Rhinitis
clinical_study.official_title: Gore Tex Implants in the Treatment of Atrophic Rhinitis

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a retrospective study, involving patients with atrophic rhinitis, that underwent Gore tex® implants in the nasal fossa.
The Fetid Rhinitis or Atrophic Ozena is a chronic illness characterized by yellowish secretion in the initial phase and the other phases with fetid crusts and atrophy of the mucous bone covering. Diverse theories exist that try to explain the appearance of this pathology, such as: hereditary factors, immunological alterations, viral infection and nutritional lack. Currently, its etiology remains unknown. As there isn't any ideal treatment already established, this technique improves the options of treatment.
All patients have improved after the procedure.

detailed_description.textblock: Data about 5 patients that underwent surgery to implant polytetrafluoroethylene in the nasal fossa was collect. The symptoms and complications were described.

primary_outcome.measure: improvement of fetid crusts and atrophy of the mucous bone covering

secondary_outcome.measure: lack of side effects such as infection

intervention.intervention_name: implants of polytetrafluoroethylene in tha nasal fossa
intervention.description: surgical implants of polytetrafluoroethylene in the nasal fossa

study_pop.textblock: Patients that were submit to surgery to treat atrophic rhinitis with implants in the nasal fossa.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Symptoms of atrophic rhinitis, with previous clinical treatment without good results
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with mental illness
